channel.title: Steam Gotchas
channel.description:
This is just a thread for us to post information on things that some wish they would have known ahead of time. Post more if you can think of any. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1)[/SIZE] [b]Protect your steam account with your life[/b]. Do [u]NOT use your username/password on other websites/forums [/u] and do not use your key or give your password to: -Websites - [COLOR='DarkRed']*[/SIZE] Not websites offering free games, free sex, or free anything. There are websites that phish for account details rather well so be careful. -Your mom, brother, dad, sister or other relatives -Your friends, pretend friends, bestest bestest friends in the whole wide world -Im's, Pm's, or other messaging systems ANYWHERE
[COLOR='DarkRed']*[/SIZE] The only places you should be keying your password into is the steam interface itself or http[u]s[/u]://steamcommunity.com/ (notice the S for SECURITY!) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2)[/SIZE] [b]Be careful of outside programs that could compromise your account.[/b] Viruses, keyloggers, spyware... all of that is a potential issue for your steam account so be sure you have programs to keep you clean. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 3)[/SIZE] [b]Cheats [/b]or [b]Modified core game files.[/b]
If you have done either of these things then you need to stay away from vac secured servers.
Example: You install and play PARANOIA which is a mod that clearly announces that it uses a modified opengl32.dll file. This is not a "cheat", however because it uses a modified game file... and if you do not switch it back to the original game file before going on a vac secured server... you WILL BE FLAGGED FOR A VAC BAN. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 4)[/SIZE] [b]"OMG! I have been hijacked!"[/b] If for some reason your account IS stolen from you, here is some info to read: [url='https://support.steampowered.com/cgi-bin/steampowered.cfg/php/enduser/std_adp.php?p_faqid=197']Reclaiming a Hijacked Steam Account[/url] [url='https://support.steampowered.com/cgi-bin/steampowered.cfg/php/enduser/std_adp.php?p_faqid=294']Contacting VALVe Billing and Support[/url] [url='https://support.steampowered.com/cgi-bin/steampowered.cfg/php/enduser/std_adp.php?p_faqid=301']Account Security Recommendations[/url]
[b]Here is a quick rundown in screenshots:[/b] [url]https://www.catzeyes93.com/images/SteamAccountHijackHelp[/url]
[b]Here is a quick rundown in text:[/b] You have a[color=darkorange] steam account to play games on You have a [color=royalblue]steam forum account to post on these forums You have a [color=red]steam support account for times you are having issues with your [color=darkorange]steam account
1) Register a [color=red]steam support account here: [url='https://support.steampowered.com/register.php']https://support.steampowered.com/register.php[/url] 2) Then go to create a support ticket here: [url='https://support.steampowered.com/newticket.php']https://support.steampowered.com/newticket.php[/url] 3) Be sure to give them as much information about your steam account and what happened. 4) Be prepared to offer them proof of ownership. (Purchase receipt, CC billing statement, jpg scan of cd key or other proof of purchase) 5) You will be using your steam support account to check on the status of your ticket here [url]https://support.steampowered.com/ticketlist.php[/url] as well as sending any additional requested info.
[b]Note: Tickets are answered in the order they are received, however they normally are taken care of in 3 - 5 business days.[/b] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 5)[/SIZE] [b]"No thank you!"[/b] Be careful who you accept gifts from! Be VERY careful! Example: Joe Shmoe is a Smuck. He stole his best friends mom's credit card and went out and purchased a bunch of games with it. He then turned around and either gave them away via the "gift" system or he SOLD the games. The unsuspecting person receives this gift or game and assigns it to his uber leet kewl steam account that has over $200 dollars worth of games on it. A month later Steam disables the whole account due to credit card fraud. You heard me. They shutdown the [u]whole account[/u]...not just the game that was purchased with a stolen credit card! So take care of where you get your games from!

item.title: Steam Gotchas
item.dc:creator: The_Mindfucker
item.description:
My account got its password changed 2 weeks ago and i brougt it up to steam…2 weeks ago, still nothing. They sent me a E-mail "saying they where going to send me a new password, and here i still sit waiting, for 2 weeks :’(. I have never gave my account password away (since the last incident), so it was a hacker. I need help with stress. Does anyone have an idea to relive it without using a chainsaw on the people i hate:fffuuu:.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Gotchas
item.dc:creator: Spooboy
item.description:
If anyone has recently played part to and or installed the Built on Energy (BoE) client for cs or css it is very highly advised that it is removed. This client was not made by or fully checked by BoE staff. Small instances have occurred claiming that this client is a key logger and will hijack your steam account as well as other stored information on your PC. Not that anyone really needed this message but im sure if you are in BoE and have not heard about its “death” then you will be interested in knowing that you should probably remove the client.

Read full topic
